shortdesc.ph: Position of video frames in the video observer.
Position of the video frame in the video observer.

plentry.pd: (1): Position after local video capture and preprocessing, corresponding to the callback. Video at this position has applied pre-processing effects, which can be verified by enabling beauty effects, virtual background, or watermark.
(2): Position before rendering, corresponding to the video data in the callback.

(4): Position before encoding, corresponding to the video data in the callback. Video at this position has applied both pre-processing and pre-encoding effects.
To verify pre-processing effects, you can enable beauty effects, virtual background, or watermark.
To verify pre-encoding effects, you can set a low frame rate (e.g., 5 fps).

(8): Position after local video capture and before preprocessing. Video at this position has not applied pre-processing effects and can be verified by enabling beauty effects, virtual background, or watermark.

(1): The position of the locally captured video data after preprocessing, corresponding to the callback. The video at this position has applied video preprocessing effects, which can be verified by enabling beauty effects, virtual background, or watermark.
(2): The position before rendering, corresponding to the video data in the callback.

(4): The position before encoding, corresponding to the video data in the callback. The video at this position has applied video preprocessing and pre-encoding effects.
To verify video preprocessing effects, you can enable beauty effects, virtual background, or watermark.
To verify pre-encoding effects, you can set a lower frame rate (e.g., 5 fps).

(8): The position after local video capture and before preprocessing. The video at this position has not applied preprocessing effects, which can be verified by enabling beauty effects, virtual background, or watermark.
